      • Union

        public Relation Union(Relation relation)
        This method determines the union of two relations with same dimension. Every element of one relation is compared with the corresponding element from the other relation and if one of them is true then it writes true in the output relation.
        Parameters:
        relation - is one of the input relation for union method. The other input relation accessed using this operator in java.
        Returns:
        union of two relation.

      • Intersection

        public Relation Intersection(Relation relation)
        This method determines the intersection of two relation with same dimension. Every element of one relation is compared with the corresponding element from the other relation and if both of them is true then it writes true in the output relation.
        Parameters:
        relation - is one of the input relation for union method. The other input relation accessed using this operator in java.
        Returns:
        intersection of two relation

      • Composition

        public Relation Composition(Relation relation)
        This method calculates the relative multiplication of two relation. The (x,z) element would be true in the resulting relation if and only if there exists one element y such that (x,y) is true in the first relation and (y,z) is true in the other relation.
        Parameters:
        relation - one of the input relation for union method. The other input relation accessed using this operator in java.
        Returns:
        the composition of two relation.

      • RightResidue

        public Relation RightResidue(Relation relation)
        This method calculates the left residual of two relation R and S (R\S) which is the greatest of all relation X with (R.X) is the subset of S.
        Parameters:
        relation - one of the input relation for union method. The other input relation accessed using this operator in java.
        Returns:
        the left residue of two relation.

      • LeftResidue

        public Relation LeftResidue(Relation relation)
        This method calculates the right residual of two relation R and S (R/S) which is the greatest of all relation X with (X.R) is the subset of S.
        Parameters:
        relation - one of the input relation for union method. The other input relation accessed using this operator in java.
        Returns:
        right residue of two relation.

      • Epsilon

        public static Relation Epsilon(int element)
        This method creates an entry for each subset. For example, there are a total of 8 subsets for 3 elements.Then this method creates a relation with dimension 8 by 3 where row represents each of the subset and column represents each object. Empty subset contain 0 for every column while subset with one element contain 1 in the column which represents the element in the subset.
        Parameters:
        element - no of elements in the set.
        Returns:
        the epsilon relation for the input.

      • SymetricQuotient

        public Relation SymetricQuotient(Relation relation)
        This method calculates the intersection of left residue and right residue to two relation R and S. Let define R:X-Y and S:X-Z. Then the symmetric quotient relates an element y from Y to an element z from Z when y and z have the same set of inverse image with respect to R and S respectively.
        Parameters:
        relation - one of the input relation for union method. The other input relation accessed using this operator in java.
        Returns:
        symmetric quotient of two relation.

      • GenerateConcepts

        public Relation GenerateConcepts()
        This method derives all concepts from a relational data set.
        Returns:
        it returns all concepts in the form of matrix where true represent concept.

      • GetAttributeSet

        public Relation GetAttributeSet()

      • GenerateConceptsV2

        public Relation GenerateConceptsV2()

      • IdentityRelation

        public static Relation IdentityRelation(int size)
        This static method returns an identity relation i.e. a square relation with ones on the main diagonal and zero elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        size - the dimension of matrix. This size is set as the row and column of the identity relation.
        Returns:
        the identity relation with specified dimension.

      • Transpose

        public Relation Transpose()
        This method flips the relation, that is it switches the row and column by producing another relation.
        Returns:
        it returns transposed relation

      • Iota

        public static Relation Iota(int m,
                            int n)
        This method create a relation with 1 and 0. The relation dimension depends on the input parameters. For example, if m and n two parameters in the function then relation consist of (m) rows and (m+n) columns. The result relation contains 1 for those indexes where row and column represents same element from m and 0 elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        m - the first parameter.
        n - the second parameter.
        Returns:
        the iota relation consist of 1 and 0.

      • Kappa

        public static Relation Kappa(int m,
                             int n)
        This method create a relation with 1 and 0. The relation dimension depends on the input parameters. For example, if m and n two parameters in the function then relation consist of (n) rows and (m+n) columns. The result relation contains 1 for those indexes where row and column represents same element from n and 0 elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        m - the first parameter.
        n - the second parameter.
        Returns:
        the kappa relation consist of 1 and 0.

      • Pi

        public static Relation Pi(int m,
                          int n)
        This method create a relation with 1 and 0. The relation dimension depends on the input parameters. For example, if m and n two parameters in the function then relation consist of (m*n) rows and (m) columns. The result relation contains 1 for those indexes which represents the row element and 0 elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        m - the first parameter.
        n - the second parameter.
        Returns:
        the pi relation consist of 1 and 0.

      • Rho

        public static Relation Rho(int m,
                           int n)
        This method create a relation with 1 and 0. The relation dimension depends on the input parameters. For example, if m and n two parameters in the function then relation consist of (m*n) rows and (n) columns. The result relation contains 1 for those indexes which represents the row element and 0 elsewhere.
        Parameters:
        m - the first parameter.
        n - the second parameter.
        Returns:
        the rho relation consist of 1 and 0.

      • Up

        public Relation Up()
        This function takes relation as a input. If the relation entry getter than 0 then this makes the entry 1 otherwise keep the same.
        Returns:
        modified matrix with 1 and 0 only

        public Relation Down()
